transportAdvice: Durban has a bus rapid transit system serving key corridors including the beachfront and city centre, though coverage can be limited in outer areas; taxis, both metered and shared minibus types, are widely available for getting around. Walking is practical along the Golden Mile beachfront but less advisable in some inner-city areas, especially after dark.

weather.description: Hot and humid midsummer with frequent afternoon thunderstorms and warm ocean temperatures ideal for swimming.
Continues hot and humid with regular heavy downpours, typical of peak summer conditions.
Still warm and wet as summer begins to ease, with occasional intense rain events.
Temperatures start to drop pleasantly and rainfall becomes less frequent, making for comfortable conditions.
Mild and mostly dry with cooler evenings, one of the more pleasant months for outdoor exploration.
Dry and sunny winter conditions with cool nights but warm daytime temperatures, excellent for sightseeing.
The driest month of the year with clear skies and comfortable warmth during the day.
Still dry and sunny with temperatures beginning to climb slightly toward spring.
Spring arrives with warming temperatures and increasing sunshine, a popular time to visit.
Warmer and occasionally showery as the wet season begins to build toward summer.
Hot and increasingly humid with more frequent afternoon storms signalling the return of summer rains.
Full summer heat and humidity with regular heavy rainfall, though warm seas make beach visits appealing.
